[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Function: ray_div()] [Zero Divisor] Can an attacker trigger b=0 condition through carefully crafted external calls, causing ray_div to abort at line 86 and DoS critical vault price calculations? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Function: ray_div()] [Precision Loss] For small values of a relative to b, does integer division truncation at line 91 produce incorrect near-zero results affecting minimum threshold checks? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Function: ray_div()] [HalfB Edge Case] When b=1, does halfB=0 at line 87, removing all rounding correction and potentially causing incorrect results in edge-case interest calculations? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Function: ray_div()] [Assertion Precision] Can the check at line 89 miss overflow cases where a * RAY succeeds but adding halfB causes u256 overflow? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Function: ray_to_wad()] [Assertion Bypass] Can result = halfRatio + a overflow at line 99 but still satisfy result >= halfRatio at line 100 due to wraparound, bypassing the overflow check? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Function: ray_to_wad()] [Precision Loss] For ray values below WAD_RAY_RATIO (1e9), does the conversion to wad at line 102 truncate to zero, breaking minimum balance tracking in the vault? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Function: ray_to_wad()] [Rounding Consistency] Does the halfRatio rounding at lines 98-99 produce consistent results across different ray value ranges, or can it introduce systematic bias in oracle price conversions? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Function: ray_to_wad()] [Division Truncation] After rounding up by halfRatio, does the division by WAD_RAY_RATIO at line 102 still lose significant precision for certain ray values? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Function: ray_to_wad()] [Edge Case] When a = RAY (1.0 in ray), does ray_to_wad return exactly WAD (1.0 in wad), or does rounding cause slight deviation affecting parity checks? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Function: ray_to_wad()] [Max Value] For a = address::max(), will the addition at line 99 overflow and the assertion at line 100 correctly catch it, or can overflow occur after the assertion? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Function: wad_to_ray()] [Assertion Bypass] Can the check at line 110 (result / WAD_RAY_RATIO == a) pass even when result has overflowed due to u256 wraparound properties? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Function: wad_to_ray()] [Precision Assumption] Does wad_to_ray assume perfect precision multiplication, and can rounding errors in prior wad calculations cause the reverse conversion to produce incorrect ray values? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Function: wad_to_ray()] [Zero Input] When a=0, does wad_to_ray correctly return 0, or could there be edge cases in the assertion at line 110 for zero values? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Function: wad_to_ray()] [Maximum Wad] For a = address::max() / WAD_RAY_RATIO, does the conversion succeed or fail, and what is the maximum safe wad value that can be converted to ray? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Function: wad_to_ray()] [Reverse Conversion] After converting wad→ray→wad, does the final value always equal the original wad due to the rounding in ray_to_wad, or can precision be lost? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Function: wad_mul() + ray_to_wad()] [Mixed Precision] When vault operations mix wad and ray precision (e.g., multiplying wad shares by ray interest rates), can incorrect conversions cause share inflation/deflation? (High)

(High)
